search_results.snippet: Strom Thurmond. James Strom Thurmond (December 5, 1902  June 26, 2003) was an American politician who served for 48 years as a United States Senator from South Carolina. He ran for president in 1948 as the States Rights Democratic Party candidate, receiving 2.4% of the popular vote and 39 electoral votes.
